title: Can't connect to game - Firewall Error
body:
I've been trying to connect to my game for the last 15 minutes or so. I've tried restarting my computer and restarting league multiple times but every time I get that Firewall error popup thing.

Is there any way I can fix this? Do I have to reinstall or something?

replies.body:
Not just Spark, I'm from Australia, having the same issues with Optus. Now lose ranked promos and get 20/30 min time penalty, this is stupid.
Edit: Yep, to make it even better dc'ing counts as TWO LOSSES in my promos (went from 6 games played to 8) and still have 20 min time penalty, what the %%%% Riot

Happening to me, too. I'm also with Optus. Wtf is this. Wednesday is like the worst day for this to happen to me, too. No school on Wednesdays for me, and I can't even spend it playing League :'(

EDIT: This just in, I had to type that "I Agree" stupid thing to say I'll never leave games again. Sorry RIOT but this isn't exactly my fault...
That's good to know. Hopefully riot can fix it then and it's not just a problem with Spark
Might be a problem with one of the routing servers over in Aus then - Fayrr's network test timed out at a server in Sydney.
Currently running a network test of my own, but it's timing out after reaching my modem.

Anyone still hanging out in this thread should head over this way:

http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/announcements/IOuWqG7B-troubleshooting-connection-issues-4032015

Be sure to post your network information so we get a hasty resolution for this issue.

Thanks for posting this Fayrr! 

Posting network information using the Network Diagnostic Tool in that thread really helps us narrow down the root cause of these issues, so thanks again!

Same problem
Im in New Zealand, Wellington/Porirua
I use Telecom
Wired

Now i have 2 leaves in my match history(both ranked)
are we gonna get those games back or will riot just throw out penalties for something that is not our fault?
Hastings here. Definitely sounds like a Riot-Spark issue.

Same issue here.

Location: New Zealand, Hamilton
Provider: Spark, ADSL
Connection: Wired
OS: Win 7 Ultimate
No VPN 

I attached results from the network diagnostic tool.

Also made a support ticket id #16337188

Contacted Spark and they denied that there was an issue. Then they tried to get me to subscribe to some technician service for $15 a month. What a joke.

Looks like things are dropping out somewhere in NZ, and in Sydney, Australia.

Speaking of Hamilton though, I'm there as well. Anyone else in Hamilton, or is it happening all over the country?
I'm in Christchurch

Do you have a firewall installed?

What OS are you on, and who's your ISP?

I don't have any 3rd party firewalls or anything. I've tried disabling my firewall but it didn't work.

OS is Windows 7 and ISP is Spark
Riot have recently done a fix on their end. Did this fix the problem for you?
It isnt only Spark, having same issue but with SnapNZ.

I am having the same issue, I thought it was a one off, but still its not working it's been an hour now. I thought initially it was cause of the programs open or firewall but I have closed everything and even turned off fire wall I have a windows7 OS and telecom is the ISP.
Yeah servers/OCE client is a little broken. Nothing to do but wait for Dota to win your hearts and join the only game that matters in the Moba circuit. See you at Roshan!!!
More national problems from Spark/Telecom. Time to look for a new ISP?
Spark service status
I checked this out and the broadband message appears to be an alert that there is going to be a maintained on Saturday. I live chatted and phoned them and they denied any issues.
Whats the link to that page?
https://www.spark.co.nz/help/servicealert/broadbandservicealert/ is the link when you click on the orange broadband bubble.

The Service Status is just a warning about their planned "upgrades" over the weekend from Saturday the 7th to Monday. As far as they're concerned everything's working perfectly on their end, and therefore it must be an identical problem on the ends of several different users at once.

I called them. They didn't fix anything
Same with me, I spectated my game using lol replay and two others on my team didn't/couldn't connect O.O

Just had this now. Three people couldn't connect to the game. Duo'd with a friend and we both couldn't connect to the game even after retrying and disabling firewall throughout. The game ended it says leaver in my match history. The only thing we could think of is we're both with Spark as our ISP.
I'm with Spark too and it seems everyone else is, maybe they're the problem? :/
Spark certainly seems to be a common factor in all of this. I really wouldn't be surprised if they've screwed everything up for the sixteen-hyperbollilionth time.
GG Spark.

Nice to know other people are having the same problem and it's not just me.
I'm using Windows 7 and my ISP is Spark (Telecom)
God damnit Spark

I've been having the same issues this morning. I've restarted my PC, I've restarted League, I've added exceptions for League in my firewall, and I've outright disabled my firewall. Still no success.

Edit: I'm running Windows 7 64-bit, and my ISP is Spark (formerly Telecom NZ)
